Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:

Qed.```

Example 2:

intros n m. induction n.

Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:

Goal:
PSeries a 0 = a 0%nat

Premises:
PSeries = fun (a : nat -> R) (x : R) => Series (fun k : nat => a k * x ^ k) : (nat -> R) -> R -> R Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
PSeries_1 : forall a : nat -> R, PSeries a 1 = Series a
PSeries_ext : forall (a b : nat -> R) (x : R), (forall n : nat, a n = b n) -> PSeries a x = PSeries b x
is_pseries_unique : forall (a : nat -> R) (x l : R), is_pseries a x l -> PSeries a x = l
PSeries_eq : forall (a : nat -> R) (x : R), PSeries a x = Series (fun k : nat => scal (pow_n x k) (a k))
BinNatDef.N.to_nat = fun a : N => match a with | 0%N => 0%nat | N.pos p => Pos.to_nat p end : N -> nat Argument scope is [N_scope]
Series_ext : forall a b : nat -> R, (forall n : nat, a n = b n) -> Series a = Series b
is_series_unique : forall (a : nat -> R) (l : R), is_series a l -> Series a = l
Series_correct : forall a : nat -> R, ex_series a -> is_series a (Series a)
PSeries_correct : forall (a : nat -> R) (x : R), ex_pseries a x -> is_pseries a x (PSeries a x)
Rle_div_l : forall a b c : R, c > 0 -> a / c <= b < -> a <= b * c
Rlt_div_r : forall a b c : R, c > 0 -> a * c < b < -> a < b / c
fct_cte = fun a _ : R => a : R -> R -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
derive_pt_const : forall a x : R, derive_pt (fct_cte a) x (derivable_pt_const a x) = 0
Series = fun a : nat -> R => real (Lim_seq (sum_n a)) : (nat -> R) -> R Argument scope is [function_scope]
interval_finite_subdiv : forall (a b : R) (eps : posreal), a <= b -> {l : list R | seq.head 0 l = a /\ seq.last 0 l = b /\ (forall i : nat, (S i < seq.size l)%nat -> seq.nth 0 l i < seq.nth 0 l (S i) <= seq.nth 0 l i + eps)}
Rminus_le_0 : forall a b : R, a <= b < -> 0 <= b - a
Rminus_lt_0 : forall a b : R, a < b < -> 0 < b - a

pow_ne_zero : forall n : nat, n <> 0%nat -> 0 ^ n = 0
ssrnat.leq = fun m n : nat => eqtype.eq_op (ssrnat.subn m n) 0%nat : nat -> nat -> bool Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0%nat => 0%nat | S p => (m + mul p m)%nat end : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Rlt_minus_r : forall a b c : R, a < b - c < -> a + c < b
Rle_minus_l : forall a b c : R, a - c <= b < -> a <= b + c
pos = fun p : posreal => let (pos, _) := p in pos : posreal -> R pos is a coercion
BinNatDef.N.div_eucl = fun a b : N => match a with | 0%N => (0%N, 0%N) | N.pos na => match b with | 0%N => (0%N, a) | N.pos _ => BinNatDef.N.pos_div_eucl na b end end : N -> N -> N * N Argument scopes are [N_scope N_scope]
sum_f_R0 = fix sum_f_R0 (f : nat -> R) (N : nat) {struct N} : R := match N with | 0%nat => f 0%nat | S i => sum_f_R0 f i + f (S i) end : (nat -> R) -> nat -> R Argument scopes are [function_scope nat_scope]
Init.Nat.sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0%nat => n | S k => match m with | 0%nat => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Init.Nat.max = fix max (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0%nat => m | S n' => match m with | 0%nat => n | S m' => S (max n' m') end end : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Rabs_triang : forall a b : R, Rabs (a + b) <= Rabs a + Rabs b
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0%nat => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Newton_integrable = fun (f : R -> R) (a b : R) => {g : R -> R | antiderivative f g a b \/ antiderivative f g b a} : (R -> R) -> R -> R -> Type Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope R_scope]

seq.iota = fix iota (m n : nat) {struct n} : list nat := match n with | 0%nat => Datatypes.nil | S n' => (m :: iota (S m) n')%list end : nat -> nat -> list nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
fact = fix fact (n : nat) : nat := match n with | 0%nat => 1%nat | S n0 => (S n0 * fact n0)%nat end : nat -> nat Argument scope is [nat_scope]
INR = fix INR (n : nat) : R := match n with | 0%nat => 0 | 1%nat => 1 | S (S _ as n0) => INR n0 + 1 end : nat -> R Argument scope is [nat_scope]
